result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose R Orellana was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jose R Orellana is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jose R Orellana was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)3.
  • Jose R Orellana was found guilty of Knowingly Possess Methamphetamine Waste [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.67(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Complete sobriety from alcohol and other drugs. May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician presently treating the defendant.

records.addlTxt:
Jose R Orellana, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Jair Chamuel Alvarez.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. SWITS translator Sarah Tapia sworn in on oath. PSI has been received by parties. No errors or omissions. Investigation report author is present in court.
PSI

Jose R Orellana, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel Jair Chamuel Alvarez appearing by phone means.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Pre-sentence investigation has not been received by the state. Defense has received PSI by e-mail format. Judges office to contact preparer of PSI to notify of non-receipt. In-person SWITS reporter to be notified.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on July 28, 2016 at 11:30 am.
to set over proceedings

Jose R Orellana, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel Jair Chamuel Alvarez.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. SWITS Interpreter sworn in on oath. Amended Information filed. Count one reduced. Defendant pleads no contest to count 1. Other counts remain the same. Mr. Orellana pleads no contest to count 2, counts 3-10 dismissed by state pursuant to plea agreement, to be read in for purposes of sentencing. Pre-sentence investigation report ordered due by July 11. Copies to go to Mr. Alvarez and Mr. Luhman.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Jair Chamuel Alvarez appearing on behalf of defendant.
Jose R Orellana, defendant does not appear.
Gary L. Luhman appearing as prosecuting attorney.

Jose R Orellana, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel Jair Chamuel Alvarez.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney. SWITS interpreter James Larson in person. Interpreter sworn in on oath. Information has been filed. Defendant pleas not guilty, matter set for DA PTC April 26, 10:30. Atty Alvarez makes argument for a bail modification, Atty Kohl does not agree. Court denies motion for bail modification at this time.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Arraignment at 02-25-2016 09:00 am
#1 Thru #13 - Photos 14 - 24 are labeled criminal #26 in exhibit room.

Jose R Orellana, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel Jair Chamuel Alvarez.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. SWITS Interpreter James Larson appears in person. Interpreter sworn in on oath. Exhibits 1-24 marked. Officer Michael Mortimer sworn in on oath and testified. Exhibits 2-5 Identified. Witness identifies defendant. Exhibit 1 identified. Exhibits 7-10 identified. Exhibit 6 identified. Exhibits 11-12 Identified, Exhibits 14-22 Identified. Exhibit 13 identified. Atty Luhman moves for Exhibits 2-5, 7-10, 12, and 14-22 to be received as evidence. Atty Alvarez asks for a five minute recess, granted. Back on record 4:38 PM appearances remain the same. No further witnesses. State motions for bind over. Defense objects to bind over. Court finds probable cause and binds matter over. DA Luhman files information with same charge and penalties. Matter set over for arraignment.
Defendant's Amended Motion to Reduce Bail
Defendant's Motion To Reduce Bail

Jose R Orellana, defendant appeared in Court by video in custody with counsel Jane Ellen Bucher, and SWITS by phone.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney.  Court advises defendant of rights.  Defendant given complaint.  Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.
SPD argues bail and cites Riverside argument. Court finds delay not unreasonable after probable cause review held.
